meanings.definition: The final phase or conclusion of a game or competition.
meanings.sent1: During the endplay, the players were all focused on winning.
meanings.sent2: The endplay of the chess match determined the ultimate winner.
meanings.sent3: In the endplay, the audience cheered loudly for the victorious team.
meanings.sent4: The endplay of the soccer game was filled with suspense and excitement.
meanings.sent5: The endplay of the card game left everyone on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: To play the final moves in a game or competition in order to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: She carefully planned her endplay to secure the victory.
meanings.sent2: The team decided to endplay their way to success.
meanings.sent3: He endplayed his opponents with strategic moves and quick thinking.
meanings.sent4: The chess master endplayed his way to checkmate in just a few moves.
meanings.sent5: Endplaying in the final round, she outsmarted her competitors and won the game.
